summary: "Nous is a force of her own", as she has been described. She is persistent in her drive to understand the world around her, creative in solving problems, and charismatic in leading the way forward. Over 30 years of love, curiosity, bewilderment and professional practice, are a guarantee to her vast experience and knowledge of Dutch visual arts and of the contexts in which contemporary artists and organizations operate.

profile_positions.description:
o The Sociological Studio for Policy and Research is a sociological research and advisory practice, established in 2016 in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, and operates in the domains of the arts, heritage, urbanity, and global development. 

o It conducts analysis of the structures and the strategic behavior of institutional actors, in relation to fundamental historical processes of change.  

o The Studio embraces assignments that truly ‘can make me tick.’ These may consist of the development, practical facilitation and implementation of policy and managerial solutions, especially with regards to organizational strategy and entrepreneurship (visibility, collaboration, innovation, resource development).

company.name: Dutch Council for Culture I Raad voor Cultuur

profile_positions.description:
o  The ‘Raad voor Cultuur’ (1995) is the legal advisory body to the Dutch Government and 
Parliament in the fields of art, culture and media. The Council advises, both asked and unasked 
on cultural policy in the Netherlands. 

o  Committees are responsible for the preparation of advices regarding domain-specific subjects. They also follow the government-subsidized cultural institutes ('BIS') and prepare the advices regarding the subsidization of these institutes. Members are appointed by the Minister of Education, Culture and Science for a term of four years. 

o For specific advisory processes, the Council relies on external consultants that form a circle (or pool) of advisors whose expertise can enhance the themes at hand. 

Specific roles I have fulfilled:
o  Member of the Committee for Visual Arts, Design, and Architecture (2013-17).
o  Chair of the Committee (2015-16).
o  Chair of the BIS 2017-20 advisory committee for Creative Industries (2016).
o  Member of the BIS 2017-20 advisory committees for Visual Arts (2016).
o  Member of the sector advise Visual Arts committee (2017-18).
profile_positions.title: Advisor

profile_positions.description:
o  The Creative Industries Fund NL (2012) is the culture fund for architecture, design, e-culture and all possible crossovers. The Fund supports national and international projects, talents and cross-sectoral activity programs in the creative industry. A major theme is to improve the chain between designers/makers and clients/producers. 

o For the creative industries the festivals serve as an effective link between makers, designers, artists, academics, institutions and the public (professionals, experts and/or a wide-ranging public). Thanks to the hybrid mix of performances, presentations, workshops and debates, festivals provide insight into the latest developments in a short space of time. The financial contribution is intended for the preparation, organizational set-up and actual staging of festivals focused on architecture, design or e-culture that will take place in the Netherlands. Annual budget is € 800.000 per year / project grants (2017).
profile_positions.title: Member of the Committee for Festivals

volunteer_experiences.description:
Rib is a space for art, where the interplay between different forms and formats informs its layered and extradisciplinary programme. Rib is driven by both the vision of the artists and the will to challenge the institutionalising conditions for the production and presentation of contemporary art. Since its inception, Rib has employed an evolutionary logic instead of a thematic succession; exhibitions, collaborations, recurring (online) residencies, long-term projects and off-site interventions all interlock to animate this living organism. Founded by Maziar Afrassiabi in 2015, Rib is housed in a former butcher shop in Rotterdam-Charlois.

http://www.ribrib.nl/

Largo (2017) is a non profit organization that enhances the production and distribution of artistic works developed around upcoming and talented performance-videoartist Karel van Laere. 

http://karelvanlaere.com/
